subject: Productivity
title: First Principles Thinking
description: A fast breakdown of First Principles Thinking for builders.

hook.text: Elon Musk needed cheap rocket fuel. Instead of buying from suppliers, he asked: what are rockets actually made of?

buildup.text: First principles thinking breaks problems down to their most basic truths, then rebuilds from there.

discovery.text: Aristotle originated the concept. Musk applied it: raw materials for rockets cost 2% of the finished price.

twist.text: Most people reason by analogy: this is how it's always been done. First principles asks: but why?

climax.text: First principles thinking is slow and effortful. But it finds solutions that incremental thinking never will.

punchline.text: Don't copy the answer. Derive it from scratch.

quiz.question: What does first principles thinking do?
options: Breaks problems down to basic truths and rebuilds from there
Focuses only on quick short-term wins
